alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Mercer; Middlesex; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...northern New Jersey...and southern New Jersey...including the following counties...in central New Jersey...Mercer and Monmouth. In northern New Jersey... Middlesex. In southern New Jersey...Burlington and Ocean. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Rainfall totals up to 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, East Brunswick, Manalapan, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Bordentown, Cranbury, Presidential Lakes Estates, Lakehurst, and Allentown. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 7 and 9. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 56 and 59. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 30. Garden State Parkway near mile marker 94. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
